trial_identification.studytitle: Nicotinamide and innate immunity in patients with bronchiectasis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Enhanced innate immunity and killing of respiratory pathogens by nicotinamide in patients with bronchiectasis

interventions.interventions: Participants will take oral nicotinamide capsules twice daily in one of the 4 dosage groups for a total duration of 2 weeks:- 1500mg twice daily 2000mg twice daily 2500mg twice daily 3000mg twice daily compliance will be ensured by capsules count at every follow up visit, blood will be collected for nicotinamide level prior to start of nicotinamide taking and then at every follow up visit.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Dose of nicotinamide required to achieve serum level of 1 mM, this will be assessed by collecting blood samples for serum nicotinamide level analysis at each follow up visits from visit 2 to visit 5

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Counts of surviving bacterial colony-forming units after inoculation of the pathogen with nicotinamide treated blood

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - Male or female aged between 18 to 80 years old - able to provide written consent form - Patients with confirmed bronchiectasis by High resolution CT scan - history of at least one pulmonary exacerbation in the past 12 months - healthy volunteers should be never smoker with no underlying acute or chronic medical conditions and not taking regular medications
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - Pregnant or lactating women - patients with significant medical conditions other than bronchiectasis - patients with significant abnormal liver function or with liver cirrhosis - patients with a history of non-adherence with medications

trial_design.designfeatures: One volunteer and one bronchiectasis patient will be allocated to each of the 4 dosing groups by sequence.
trial_design.statisticalmethods: The primary outcome nicotinamide levels will be described and analysed at baseline, 48hours, 1 week and 2 weeks. Descriptives will be produced for all other study outcomes at each time point.

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
We aim to determine the dose of nicotinamide (NAM) that achieves a serum level of at least 1 mM, and also to assess the effect of nicotinamide on upregulation of neutrophil function and bacterial killing in both patients with bronchiectasis and healthy volunteers.
We want to prove if nicotinamide may augment neutrophil function and enhance the killing of respiratory pathogens in patients with bronchiectasis
